audience: High school students preparing for the SAT (Reading & Writing)

teacher_notes.assessment: 4-item unit check; label one function on exit.

learning_objectives: Identify how a sentence functions in context.
Use signal words to track logic.
Choose answers that preserve the author’s purpose.

structure.title: Text Structure
objectives: Label contrast, cause, example, or conclusion.

lecture_script.script: Ask what the sentence does: introduce, contrast, explain, or conclude. Signal words often reveal the function.
Underline ‘however,’ ‘therefore,’ ‘for example,’ and match them to contrast, cause, or illustration.
Name the function of the underlined sentence in three words or fewer.

worked_example.passage: Many assumed the comet would dim quickly; however, new measurements showed it brightening near the sun.
worked_example.question: What is the function of ‘however’?
worked_example.explanation: ‘However’ contrasts prior assumption with new data.

practice_set.passage: The device saves energy; therefore, it reduces monthly costs.
practice_set.question: The transition primarily shows

unit_check.question: Function questions ask what a sentence

homework: Mark contrast/cause/example in a short article and label each.
Replace three vague connectors with precise ones.
Write two sentences that conclude a paragraph appropriately.
